thread.title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino fires up his stars in training as they prepare for title-chasing battle against Manchester City
thread.title_full: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino fires up his stars in training as they prepare for title-chasing battle against Manchester City

author: rforrester
title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino fires up his stars in training as they prepare for title-chasing battle against Manchester City
text:
6 Mauricio Pochettino had his players riled up in training 
Despite the huge game with City approaching at the weekend, Spurs’ stars didn’t hold back in training as a couple of fiery challenges flew in on the likes of Harry Kane and Mousa Dembele. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Pochettino must have been thinking of wrapping his big names in cotton wool. 
Spurs head into the fixture with Pep Guardiola’s Manchester City full of confidence and in fine form on the back of seven successive wins in all competitions. 
And they have every right to believe they can make it eight after City were thrashed by Everton 4-0 in their last outing. 
But they will have to do it without Jan Vertonghen in the heart of their defence. 
Latest scans reveal that the Belgian could face up to two months out after he came off the pitch in tears following an ankle injury he picked up in the win over West Brom. Getty Images Tottenham stars are braced for a scrap against Man City Getty Images Tottenham head into the fixture on the back of seven straight wins related articles Back of the net Spurs' net spend over last five years is just £1m, putting Man City's £402m to shame Robbie Keane for payday Tottenham legend Robbie Keane jokes he'd 'walk to China' for the money they're offering stars Butt of the joke Ex-Manchester United flop Alexander Buttner trolls Steven Gerrard over lack of league titles Plan without Jan Tottenham fear Jan Vertonghen could be out of action for up to TWO MONTHS after scan on ankle injury Getty Images Harry Kane is wrestled to the ground as he protects the ball Getty Images 6 Spurs will have no fear heading to the Etihad Stadium on Saturday 
That could mean Pochettino, who has favoured the three at the back formation in recent weeks, could resort to a back four with Kevin Wimmer or Ben Davies. 
For Guardiola, he may be boosted with the news that Gabriel Jesus could make his City debut. 
The Brazilian, signed last summer, is waiting for his international clearance to go through and an announcement should be expected in the next day or two.
